A new month has arrived, which means a new slate of events to look forward to in Pokemon Go. The mobile game is continuing its Might and Mastery season with a host of activities and Pokemon debuts in April, including the arrival of Paldean Tauros, Mega Audino, and Gigantamax Snorlax.

There are also new raid bosses and Spotlight Pokemon to catch this month, including the rarely seen Ultra Beasts Blacephalon and Stakataka, as well as another chance to get the mythical Pokemon Marshadow. Here's a roundup of all the biggest events happening in Pokemon Go in April 2025.

April Raid Schedule

Pokemon Go is shaking up its raid rotation once again in April.

The island guardian Tapu Lele is returning to five-star raids until April 9, after which it will be replaced by the Ultra Beasts Blacephalon and Stakataka in the Western and Eastern Hemispheres, respectively. Finally, the legendary Pokemon Cresselia will return to close out the month.

Mega Raids, meanwhile, will rotate through Mega Blaziken, Mega Sceptile, and Mega Mawile, while Shadow Registeel will appear in Shadow Raids every weekend this month. A new batch of Dynamax Pokemon will also appear in Max Battles over the next few weeks.

April Spotlight Hours

Pokemon Go is hosting more Spotlight Hour events in April, with a new selection of featured Pokemon and bonuses to look forward to this month.

Every Tuesday evening from 6-7 PM local time, one particular species of Pokemon will appear in the wild more frequently than usual, making this a good opportunity to fill out your Pokedex and stock up on candy. You'll also earn an extra bonus during that hour, such as double XP or Stardust for catching Pokemon.

Stunning Styles

Pokemon Go is kicking April off with a Stunning Styles event from April 3-7.

As part of the event, the next leg of this season's Might and Mastery Special Research story will be available, with rewards like Kubfu Candy and Golden Razz Berries awaiting players who complete its different tasks.

Another free Special Research story called A Striking Shadow will also be available during the event. Players who complete the story will earn various rewards, including a chance to catch the mythical Pokemon Marshadow.

On top of that, all three variants of Paldean Tauros (Combat Breed, Blaze Breed, and Aqua Breed) will make their Pokemon Go debut. They'll be appearing in the wild and in raids alongside other Pokemon that have different forms, such as Castform, Burmy, and Shellos.

Mega Audino Raid Day

Audino's Mega-Evolved form is making its debut this month during a Mega Audino Raid Day on April 5.

From 2-5 PM local time, Mega Audino will appear in Gyms as a Mega Raid boss. Additionally, you'll have an increased chance of encountering a shiny Audino from these raids, and it'll be able to learn a new move: the Charged Attack Moonblast.

As another bonus, Pokemon Go will temporarily increase the number of Remote Raid Passes you can hold to 20, and you'll be able to earn five extra free Raid Passes when you spin the Photo Disc at Gyms. The game will also offer a free Timed Research questline during the event.

Tyrogue Hatch Day

Following Mega Audino Raid Day, Pokemon Go is hosting a Tyrogue Hatch Day event on April 6.

Throughout the event, the fighting Pokemon Tyrogue will be hatching from 2 km eggs more frequently than usual. Not only that, but you'll have increased odds of hatching a shiny Tyrogue as well.

In addition, there will be free and paid Timed Research tasks to complete during the event. A few in-game bonuses will also be available, including double candy for hatching Pokemon and increased odds of getting 2 km eggs from PokeStops.

Spring Into Spring

Pokemon Go is celebrating the changing of seasons with a Spring into Spring event from April 9-14.

As part of the event, the grass Pokemon Gossifleur and its evolved form, Eldegoss, will be available for the first time in Pokemon Go. On top of that, various grass, water, and fire Pokemon will appear in the wild more frequently on different days of the event.

In addition to the featured Pokemon, there will be event-themed Research tasks and Collection Challenges to complete. The game will also offer a few bonuses, including double candy for hatching eggs and increased odds of encountering shiny versions of Remoraid and Fletchling.

A mystery event is slated to take place April 16-22.

Gigantamax Snorlax Max Battle Day

Gigantamax Snorlax is making its Pokemon Go debut as part of a Max Battle Day on April 19.

Sweet Discoveries

A new event called Sweet Discoveries is set for April 24-29. More details about the event will be announced later this month.

Dynamax Entei Max Battle Weekend

Pokemon Go is hosting another Max Battle Weekend this month, this time featuring the legendary Pokemon Entei. The event is scheduled to run April 26-27.

Pokemon Go is rounding out the month with its April Community Day event, which takes place on Sunday, April 27.

This month's featured Pokemon is the ice type Vanillite. From 2-5 PM local time, the ice Pokemon will appear in the wild much more frequently than usual, and you'll have increased odds of encountering a shiny Vanillite.

The event also marks an opportunity to learn an exclusive move. Until May 4, any Vanillish that you're able to evolve into Vanilluxe will learn the Charged Attack Avalanche upon evolving. Avalanche boasts 90 power in PVP battles and 85 power in gym/raid battles.

On top of that, there will be an assortment of themed Field and Timed Research tasks to complete during the event, as well as a handful of bonuses to take advantage of. Lure Modules and Incense that you use will last for three hours, and you'll earn triple XP and double candy for catching Pokemon. Trades will also cost 50 percent less Stardust.

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3 Mod For Stardew Valley Gets Mistakenly Pulled And Then Restored
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/baldurs-gate-3-mod-for-stardew-valley-gets-mistakenly-pulled-and-then-restored/1100-6530514/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Baldur's Village mod for Stardew Valley, which added Baldur's Gate 3 characters into the farm and life simulator, was a huge hit with fans, and even earned the stamp of approval by Larian Studios CEO Swen Vincke. However, a DMCA takedown notice issued by Wizards of the Coast briefly resulted in the fan mod being taken offline. Wizards has now clarified that the DMCA was a mistake and the mod is officially back up.

"The Baldur's Village DMCA takedown was issued mistakenly--we are sorry about that," Wizards said in a statement (via PC Gamer). "We are in the process of fixing that now so fans and the Stardew community can continue to enjoy this great mod!"

A Nexus Mods spokesperson spoke to PC Gamer when the DMCA was received, saying they were also wondering if it was a mistake. "Hopefully, this is an oversight from WotC, who often use external agencies to hunt down violating content, and they will reverse their decision," they said. "Fingers crossed for Baldur's Village."

The mod makes some of Baldur's Gate 3's main characters into villagers, even giving them their own parts of the map. These include Gale, Shadowheart, Wyll, Karlach, Halsin, and Astarion. Currently, Astarion is the only new neighbor players will be able to romance at this time, but the team has confirmed that Haslin's romance storyline is being worked on.

To get the Baldur's Village mod up and running, players will also need to install the Stardew Modding API (SMAPI), the Stardew Valley Content Patcher, and the Portraiture mod, all of which can be downloaded for free over at Nexus Mods. Once the mod is installed, you don't need to worry about starting a new game, and the mod should seamlessly integrate the new content into existing save files.

For more ways to make the most of your Stardew experience, check out our picks for the best Stardew Valley mods.

item.title: Switch 2 Games Will Be Focus Of Two Post-Direct Livestreams This Week
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/switch-2-games-will-be-focus-of-two-post-direct-livestreams-this-week/1100-6530512/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

It is going to be a big, big week for Nintendo and the Switch 2, as Nintendo has confirmed it will follow up the April 2 Nintendo Switch 2 Direct with two more days of livestreams focused on games for the console.

Nintendo's Treehouse Live broadcast series returns April 3 and 4 for what's being called a "Nintendo Switch 2 presentation featuring hands-on gameplay of Nintendo Switch 2 games." These Treehouse broadcasts will begin at 7 AM PT / 10 AM ET on April 3 and 4.

If the Treehouse Live events for Switch 2 games are similar to previous ones, fans can expect Nintendo to go deep. Previous Treehouse Live events featured Nintendo developers and designers discussing games at length while showing off gameplay. In short, you won't want to miss them. The April 3 event is four hours long, while the April 4 show is three hours, according to Nintendo.

Given that Nintendo is dedicating two days to follow-up broadcasts for the Switch 2 event with these Treehouse livestreams, it's reasonable to assume Nintendo has a lot in store for the 60-minute April 2 event.

That makes sense, of course, given the console is coming out this year and we still don't know much about it or its games. In terms of titles, many are expecting to see Mario Kart 9 and a new 3D Mario game, among others.

As for when the Switch 2 could release, the latest scuttlebutt suggests the system may release in June, priced at $400 or more. Keep checking back with GameSpot for the latest.

item.title: A Minecraft Movie Star Jack Black Says World Needs The Movie Right Now
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/a-minecraft-movie-star-jack-black-says-world-needs-the-movie-right-now/1100-6530511/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Director Jared Hess' A Minecraft Movie is what the world needs right now, according to stars Jack Black and Jason Momoa. Speaking at the movie's premiere, Black quoted Burt Bacharach's 1965 song "What The World Needs Now," and added, "We've got to work together, my god."

"There's so much violence and war and hatred. And that's what I love about this movie--there's a lot of love in it and there's a lot of creativity. There is some anger and violence too, but in the end it's about friendship and working together to make [the world] a better place," Black told The Hollywood Reporter.

Momoa, meanwhile, said "everyone needs to escape a little bit right now," and A Minecraft Movie could be a solution for them.

"It's nice to sit back and have a really fun adventure and giggle and laugh," he said.

Also in the interview, Momoa said he's hopeful A Minecraft Movie is well-received and performs well at the box office so he can make a sequel.

"We won't let you down. We worked our ass off for you, and I think we brought the world to life. I think everybody's gonna love it," he said. "There's so much more to tell; I just hope the fans will be delighted and let us make more."

A Minecraft Movie comes to theaters this Friday, April 4, and it's expected to perform about as well as Sonic the Hedgehog 3 did in the US. April also sees the release of HBO's The Last of Us Season 2 (April 13) and then Sony's Until Dawn movie (April 25), so it's a stacked month for video game adaptations.

The first social media reviews for A Minecraft Movie have begun to appear online, with people calling it "appalling" and "awkward," as well as "hilarious" and "sharp." That seems to be in keeping with tradition for movies from Hess, whose previous releases, including Napoleon Dynamite and Nacho Libre, divided audiences.
